title: Bawaria gang and the 2005 murder of an AIADMK MLA in Tamil Nadu
description: Twenty years ago, dacoits struck at a bungalow off a highway near Chennai and killed one of its occupants, K. Sudarsanam, a sitting MLA. They attacked other members of the house brutally and fled with the loot. Investigators later realised that the gang had committed a rash of robberies across a vast territory in Tamil Nadu, stretching to the borders of Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka. A Chennai court last week convicted three members of the Bawaria gang responsible for the daring robberies and sentenced them to several life terms in prison. R. Sivaraman recounts a shocking crime spree

title: ‘Politics now trumps economics’ :Jaishankar on shifting world order; calls for resilient supply lines
description: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar stated that the world is diversifying trade and energy sources beyond the US and China to hedge against contingencies. He highlighted that geopolitical shifts are prioritizing politics over economics, prompting countries to seek more production centers and resilient supply lines, with ownership and security now as crucial as cost.

title: ‘Cosmic curveball’: Glitch in most A320 planes to be fixed by today; solar-flare risk flagged
description: Indian airlines swiftly addressed a critical software issue affecting Airbus A320s, linked to solar flare risks. Operators worked through the weekend to roll back flight-control updates on 338 aircraft, preventing potential pilot control loss. This rapid fix, under DGCA supervision, avoided mass cancellations during peak holiday travel, with minimal delays reported.

description: Where were the samples taken? What has the report highlighted? What are the World Health Organization guidelines on permissible limits? Why do doctors say mothers must continue to breast feed? Why must the civic administration keep checking groundwater?

title: Sangam Vihar blaze: Four killed in Delhi; no safety systems found
description: A devastating fire ripped through a four-storey residential building in Delhi's Sangam Vihar, claiming four lives, including a brother and sister. The blaze, believed to have started in a ground-floor footwear shop, spread rapidly due to a lack of fire safety measures. Residents were trapped as the building lacked proper ventilation and had only a single, narrow escape route.

title: Canada-returned woman arrested for husband’s murder

The victim's sister alleged Rupinder had suspicions about her wife's character and a possible affair. Investigations are underway regarding their Canadian connections.

title: 50 years after her rape changed law, ‘Mathura’ lives in hunger
description: Decades after her rape in a police station sparked legal reforms, 'Mathura' now lives in poverty, paralyzed and unvisited. Her ordeal led to crucial changes in India's sexual assault laws, yet she remains excluded from welfare schemes due to her inability to navigate digital systems. Her story highlights the enduring gap between legal progress and individual justice.

title: ‘Refused marriage’: Woman shot dead in Noida; ex-boyfriend on the run
description: A 23-year-old woman was fatally shot by her ex-boyfriend in Noida after she refused his marriage proposal. The accused, Krishna, allegedly forced his way into her home and fired shots when she resisted. He then threatened neighbours before fleeing. Police have registered a murder case and are actively searching for the suspect.

Gujarat to Myanmar meth route: ED busts cross-border narco trade
description: The Enforcement Directorate has disrupted a significant international drug trafficking network. Raw chemical precursors, transported from Gujarat, are destined for Myanmar where they are converted into methamphetamine. The final products are then illicitly reintroduced into India through Mizoram. This extensive investigation has revealed connections to dummy corporations and the unlawful exploitation of Indian GST credentials by individuals from abroad.

Goltes skillfully balances her modeling career, influencer status, and life as a partner to a basketball superstar, adapting to his moves and embracing the spotlight.

Pairing ingredients like olive oil with vegetables enhances heart health, while vitamin D sources with calcium-rich foods strengthen bones.  Yogurt with berries supports gut and brain function, and iron-rich foods with vitamin C improve mental performance.  These synergistic pairings amplify health impacts for better overall wellness.

Stroud's presence is expected to reignite the offense, which has struggled in his absence.

title: US tariffs bite: India’s engineering exports slump 16.7% in October
description: India's engineering exports plunged 16.71% in October 2025, hitting $9.37 billion, largely due to a significant drop in shipments to the US and a high base effect. Key markets like Asean also saw steep declines. Despite this monthly dip, cumulative exports for April-October 2025 showed a modest 1.68% growth.

description: Pop superstar Taylor Swift's close friend Ed Sheeran only learned of her engagement to Travis Kelce a week after the news broke. Sheeran revealed he's ditched social media and his iPad, preferring in-person connections. He and Swift recently had a four-hour catch-up, highlighting their deep, effortless friendship that transcends digital updates.

title: Shrimp species rediscovered in Karnataka and Odisha after 72 years

description: A breakfast meeting between Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah and Deputy CM DK Shivakumar has temporarily eased the leadership tension, with Siddaramaiah reportedly suggesting Shivakumar take over after 2028. This arrangement, however, complicates a planned transition, leaving the party high command to navigate delicate caste dynamics and political calculations.

title: Delhi blast: Cleric among 3 with 'links to Umar' detained from Haldwani
description: Central agencies investigating the Delhi blast case detained three individuals, including a cleric from Haldwani's Banphoolpura, for alleged links to the main accused, Umar-un-Nabi. Call detail records reportedly showed communication between the cleric and Umar, prompting the raid. Heavy police presence has been deployed in the area following the detentions.

description: Uttar Pradesh administrations are offering incentives like cash rewards and jungle safaris to boost the morale of Booth Level Officers (BLOs) during a demanding voter-list revision drive. Despite these efforts and a proposal to double honorariums, BLOs face immense pressure, technical glitches, and a tight December 4 deadline, with some expressing concerns about the feasibility of the task.

Airbus software fix: DGCA says over 322 aircraft updated; completion likely soon
description: Airlines are urgently upgrading Airbus A320 aircraft software. Intense solar radiation could corrupt flight data. This directive follows an incident where an aircraft pitched downwards unexpectedly. IndiGo, Air India, and Air India Express are accelerating fixes. No aircraft can fly until the mandatory modification is complete. This global alert impacts thousands of jets, causing travel disruptions.

Ukrainian sources have claimed responsibility, stating they targeted the ships for allegedly transporting sanctioned Russian oil.

Relief efforts are underway, with authorities on high alert.

The journey, from Maharishi Valmiki's depiction of Ram's exile to modern movements and legal battles, finally saw the temple stand as a reclaimed heritage.

description: India's longest highway, NH-44, particularly its Haryana and Delhi stretches, has become a deadly corridor with alarming accident rates. In 2023, 715 deaths occurred on Haryana's NH-44 alone, a grim statistic reflecting a national road safety crisis exacerbated by speeding, design flaws, and inadequate infrastructure.

title: Inside the deal-making power of the F-35: A weapon, a network, a strategic lock-in
description: The F-35 is the United States’ one of the strongest bargaining chip because it is irreplaceable — no rival offers its stealth maturity, network warfare capability or global support infrastructure. Nations that qualify to fly it join the most advanced military ecosystem in existence; those excluded remain outside the intelligence-fusion loop that defines modern air combat.

Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
description: Over 1,000 Amazon employees have signed an open letter warning of dire consequences from the company's rapid AI development. They argue Amazon is sacrificing climate goals and its human workforce for AI dominance, citing increased emissions, water consumption for data centers, and job displacement. The workers demand ethical AI practices, including clean energy use and employee involvement in AI decisions.

title: Neurosurgeon with 25 years of experience shares 10 habits that make the brain smarter
description: Neuroscience reveals that consistent habits can reshape the brain, enhancing thinking, learning, and stress resilience. AIIMS-trained Neurosurgeon Dr. Arun L Naik shares 10 key habits, from consistent sleep to daily learning, that stimulate neural circuits and foster a smarter brain. Practicing these daily leads to sharper recall and peak performance.

title: Perez Hilton reacts as Meghan Markle accused of keeping $1,700 photoshoot gown
description: A resurfaced rumor about Meghan Markle taking a designer gown without permission, dubbed "Green Gown-gate," has sparked debate. Podcaster Perez Hilton defended Meghan, calling the claims "nonsense." Meanwhile, Meghan and Prince Harry actively participated in a Thanksgiving meal packing event through their Archewell Foundation, offering a positive counterpoint to the dress controversy.

title: 'Content is king': Kevin O’Leary advices students; claims creators earn biggest paydays
description: Shark Tank investor Kevin O'Leary has reversed his advice to students, now highlighting creative storytelling and content creation as the fastest-growing wage earners. He stated that elite content creators are achieving significant incomes by driving online sales and reducing customer acquisition costs, a stark contrast to his previous emphasis on engineering degrees.

title: US tariffs: Mark Carney tells Canadians; Levies will wipe $50 billion from Canada's economy
description: Canada's Prime Minister Mark Carney is rolling back climate rules and encouraging pipeline construction to boost the energy sector amidst US tariff uncertainty. This move aims to diversify oil exports and reduce reliance on the US market, though it sparks internal government tensions and environmentalist criticism.

title: NBA rumors: Lakers eye $186M Bucks star as they plan league’s next superteam
description: Whispers are growing louder about the Los Angeles Lakers potentially acquiring Giannis Antetokounmpo.  Reports suggest the franchise is exploring aggressive moves to build a future around Luka Dončić, even considering significant short-term sacrifices.  Complex multi-team trade scenarios are circulating, aiming to reshape multiple NBA rosters and create new championship contenders.
